info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 501 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Weston, or 7 miles west of Pembroke Pines, moving north at 5 mph.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Weston, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Palm Springs North, Sunshine Acres, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, Country Club, Pennsuco, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, and Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Miami-Dade and central Broward Counties through 545 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
